intro: Tithymalus commutatus, commonly known as the common tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The species is notable for its aromatic foliage and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
